name: GetEvents
documentation:
A request to fetch stored events for a specific aggregate in an event-sourced system.

This class is used by the Fluxzero Runtime to retrieve historical events from the event store associated with a given aggregate. It supports pagination via {@code lastSequenceNumber} and {@code batchSize} to efficiently load large event streams.

Usage

Typically used when:
  • Reconstructing an aggregate's state from its event history
  • Streaming events for external use or replay

Example

{@code
 GetEvents request = new GetEvents("order-123", 50L, 100);
 }
@see io.fluxzero.common.api.SerializedMessage @see GetEventsResult

fields.name: aggregateId
fields.documentation: The identifier of the aggregate whose events are to be retrieved.

fields.name: batchSize
fields.documentation: The maximum number of events to return in this request.

fields.name: lastSequenceNumber
fields.documentation:
The (exclusive) last known sequence number of events previously read.

The Runtime will return events with sequence numbers strictly greater than this value. Use {@code null} to retrieve from the beginning.
